medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe substernal chest pain and nausea after intravenous administration of ondansetron.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 60-year-old woman, developed nausea worse than the mild intermittent nausea present on the day of surgery. Immediately after receiving 2.0 mg of ondansetron intravenously, she experienced severe chest pain, marked ST depression in ECG, and tachyarrhythmias including ventricular tachycardia. Symptoms resolved within minutes after administration of nitroglycerin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history includes several prior minor operations with no complications and occasional extrasystole, but no other cardiac symptoms were noted.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a nonsmoker and was very physically active, exercising frequently each week.
